alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Dorchester (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 07 at 5:26PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley and Dorchester. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 526 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Moncks Corner, Dorchester, Harleyville, Pinopolis, Hussertown, Pringletown, New Hope, Spring Hill, Sandridge, Ebenezer, Francis Beidler Forest, Murraysville, Whitesville, Sugar Hill, Berkeley County Airport, Wampee and Pregnall.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
